content: Credit Card SeedlyTV EP01 Asked by AnonymousAsked on 27 Mar 2019How to know if paying tax using credit card through CardUp like service is worth it?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jaren Ng Kok LiangLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 26 May 2019I just use BOC eilte mastercard for my tax and insurance fees via cardup service. It give 1.5miles per dollar spend. For cardup fees, there is a $20 dollar rebate if you use referral code (KOKLIANGN59). So it work out to be about 1.7% for first transaction. Thought is still quite worth it.0 comments0

Adrian Goh Jun Wei, Product at NodeflairLevel 4. ProdigyUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Personally I think there's no easy way to know unless you compare the amount you are paying with such service with that of not using (I'm assuming "worth it" means you are paying less)1 comment0

Patrick Wee28 Mar 2019For miles, work out your cpm and % of cashback for cashback card.
Uob one gives u 5% of u meet the spend requirement for a quarter while the fee for cardup is around 2.6%
